# Observatoire R√©gional de la La√Øcit√© WordPress Theme

## Overview
This is a professional WordPress theme designed specifically for the "Observatoire r√©gional de la la√Øcit√© de Bourgogne-Franche-Comt√©" (Regional Observatory of Secularism for Burgundy-Franche-Comt√©). The design follows the clean, official aesthetic of laicite.gouv.fr with a focus on French government institutional styling.

## Theme Structure
- **Main template**: `index.php` - Combines all sections using `get_template_part()`
- **Header template**: `header.php` - Contains navigation and location filter
- **Footer template**: `footer.php` - Contains partner logos and legal links
- **Component templates**: Located in `parts/` directory

## Design Elements

### Color Palette
- Primary Blue: `#000091` (official French government blue - "Marianne Blue")
- White: `#FFFFFF` (backgrounds, cards)
- Light Gray: `#F6F6F6` (subtle backgrounds)
- Text: `#161616` (primary text), `#666666` (secondary text)
- Red accent: `#E1000F` (French republican red - used sparingly for CTAs)
- Border/dividers: `#DDDDDD`, `#E5E5E5`

### Typography
- Font stack: `-apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, sans-serif`
- Clear hierarchy with appropriate sizes and weights
- Excellent readability with proper line-height and spacing

## Components

### Header Component
- Organization logo on the left
- Navigation menu with: Actualit√©s, Tribune, Conf√©rences, Troph√©es de la la√Øcit√©, Formation
- Location filter dropdown for regional cities: Besan√ßon, Dijon, Auxerre, Belfort, Vesoul, Haute-Sa√¥ne
- Clean, professional styling with subtle borders

### Hero Section
- Full-width banner with French government aesthetic
- Organization title and tagline
- Clean, uncluttered design

### Quick Access Section
- Horizontal row of 4 action blocks with icons and descriptive text
- Links to key sections (Troph√©es 2025, Formations, Conf√©rences, Resources)

### Main Content Area (Two-column layout)
#### Left Column - Article Grid:
- 6-8 news articles in responsive card-based grid
- Each card includes: Category tag, Article headline, Author and publication date, Brief excerpt, "Lire la suite ‚Üí" button
- Cards have subtle shadows and hover effects

#### Right Column - Sidebar:
- "Troph√©es de la la√Øcit√© 2025" call-to-action widget
- Newsletter subscription form
- Resources links

### Footer
- Partner logos section
- Links to legal pages (Mentions l√©gales, Donn√©es personnelles, Accessibilit√©)
- Contact information
- Social media links
- Copyright notice

## Technical Implementation
- WordPress Full Site Editing (FSE) compatible
- Responsive design for mobile, tablet, and desktop
- WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility compliance
- French language content throughout
- Proper heading hierarchy and semantic HTML

## Files Created
- `style.css` - Main stylesheet with color variables and layout rules
- `functions.php` - Theme functionality and script enqueuing
- `theme.json` - Theme settings and configuration
- `index.php` - Main template file
- `header.php` - Header component
- `footer.php` - Footer component
- `parts/hero.php` - Hero section
- `parts/quick-access.php` - Quick access section
- `parts/article-grid.php` - Article grid section
- `/assets/js/navigation.js` - JavaScript for navigation and location filter
- `/assets/js/skip-link-focus-fix.js` - Accessibility enhancement
- `/assets/css/` - Custom styling

## Current Status
The theme has been implemented with all required components but currently has a PHP error in functions.php due to duplicate function definitions that need to be resolved.

# WordPress Docker Development Environment

A complete, production-ready WordPress development environment using Docker and Docker Compose with MySQL database, Nginx web server, phpMyAdmin, and WP-CLI.

This setup uses WordPress version 6.9, the latest stable release as of December 2025.

## üöÄ Prerequisites

- [Docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-docker/) (version 20.10.0 or higher)
- [Docker Compose](https://docs.docker.com/compose/install/) (version 2.0.0 or higher)
- At least 4GB of free disk space
- 2GB RAM recommended

## üìÅ Project Structure

```
wordpress-docker-project/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docker-compose.yml          # Main Docker Compose configuration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env                       # Environment variables (not committed)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env.example              # Template for environment variables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .gitignore               # Git ignore rules
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md                # This file
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ nginx/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ nginx.conf           # Nginx configuration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ssl/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ certs/              # SSL certificates (not committed)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ private/            # Private SSL keys (not committed)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ wordpress/
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ wp-content/         # WordPress content directory
```

## üîß Quick Start

### 1. Clone or download this repository

```bash
# Download the files to your local machine
# Or clone the repository if you're using version control
```

### 2. Navigate to the project directory

```bash
cd wordpress-docker-project
```

### 3. Configure environment variables

Copy the example environment file:

```bash
cp .env.example .env
```

Edit the `.env` file with your preferred editor to customize settings:

```bash
nano .env  # or use your preferred editor
```

### 4. Start the services

Start all services in detached mode:

```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

### 5. Access your WordPress installation

Once the containers are running, you can access:

- **WordPress**: [http://localhost:8080](http://localhost:8080)
- **phpMyAdmin**: [http://localhost:8081](http://localhost:8081)
- **WP-CLI**: via `docker-compose exec wpcli wp COMMAND`

## ‚öôÔ∏è Services Overview

| Service | Container Name | Port(s) | Purpose |
|---------|----------------|---------|----------|
| WordPress | `wordpress_app` | 8080 | WordPress application server |
| MySQL | `wordpress_db` | Internal | Database storage |
| Nginx | `wordpress_webserver` | 8080, 8443 | Web server and reverse proxy |
| phpMyAdmin | `wordpress_phpmyadmin` | 8081 | Database management interface |
| WP-CLI | `wordpress_wpcli` | Internal | Command-line WordPress management |

## üõ†Ô∏è Configuration

### Environment Variables

The `.env` file contains important configuration variables:

- `MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD`: Root password for MySQL
- `MYSQL_DATABASE`: Name of the WordPress database
- `MYSQL_USER`: WordPress database user
- `MYSQL_PASSWORD`: Password for the WordPress database user
- `HTTP_PORT`: Port for HTTP traffic (default: 8080)
- `HTTPS_PORT`: Port for HTTPS traffic (default: 8443)
- `PHPMYADMIN_PORT`: Port for phpMyAdmin (default: 8081)
- `WORDPRESS_TABLE_PREFIX`: Database table prefix
- `WORDPRESS_DEBUG`: Enable/disable WordPress debug mode

### WordPress Configuration

WordPress-specific configurations are stored in the `WORDPRESS_CONFIG_EXTRA` variable in the `.env` file. This allows for additional PHP constants to be defined in wp-config.php.

## üêö Using WP-CLI

WP-CLI is available for command-line WordPress management:

```bash
# Execute WP-CLI commands
docker-compose exec wpcli wp --info

# List installed plugins
docker-compose exec wpcli wp plugin list

# Activate a plugin
docker-compose exec wpcli wp plugin activate PLUGIN_NAME

# Update WordPress core
docker-compose exec wpcli wp core update

# Export database
docker-compose exec wpcli wp db export > backup.sql
```

## üîÑ Managing Containers

### Start services
```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

### Stop services
```bash
docker-compose down
```

### View logs
```bash
docker-compose logs -f
```

### View logs for specific service
```bash
docker-compose logs -f wordpress
```

### Rebuild containers
```bash
docker-compose up -d --build
```

### Restart specific service
```bash
docker-compose restart wordpress
```

## üíæ Data Persistence

Data is persisted using Docker volumes:

- MySQL data: Stored in the `db_data` named volume
- WordPress files: Stored in the `wordpress_data` named volume
- Database will persist between container restarts and recreations

## üîí Security Considerations

1. **Change default passwords**: Update all passwords in the `.env` file
2. **Environment file**: Never commit the `.env` file to version control
3. **Firewall**: Restrict access to your server ports in production
4. **Regular updates**: Keep Docker images updated with security patches

## üåê SSL/HTTPS Setup (Optional)

To enable HTTPS:

1. Place your SSL certificate and key in:
   - Certificate: `ssl/certs/cert.pem`
   - Key: `ssl/private/key.pem`

2. Update `nginx/nginx.conf` to enable SSL configuration

3. Access your site via HTTPS at [https://localhost:8443](https://localhost:8443)

## üîß Troubleshooting

### WordPress won't start

1. Check the logs:
   ```bash
   docker-compose logs wordpress
   ```

2. Verify database connection:
   ```bash
   docker-compose logs db
   ```

### Database connection issues

1. Ensure MySQL is healthy:
   ```bash
   docker-compose ps
   ```

2. Check MySQL logs:
   ```bash
   docker-compose logs db
   ```

3. Verify credentials in `.env` match WordPress configuration

### Can't access from browser

1. Check if services are running:
   ```bash
   docker-compose ps
   ```

2. Verify port mapping:
   ```bash
   docker-compose port webserver 80
   ```

### Slow loading

1. Check system resources (RAM/CPU usage)
2. Consider increasing Docker's allocated resources
3. Check WordPress plugins that might be causing delays

### Permission issues

1. Ensure the `wp-content` directory has proper ownership:
   ```bash
   sudo chown -R www-data:www-data wp-content/
   ```

## üóÑÔ∏è Backups and Restoration

### Backup Database

```bash
docker-compose exec db mysqldump -u wordpress_user -p wordpress > backup.sql
```

### Restore Database

```bash
docker-compose exec -T db mysql -u wordpress_user -p wordpress < backup.sql
```

### Backup WordPress Files

```bash
tar -czf wordpress-files.tar.gz wordpress/
```

## üì¶ Useful WordPress Plugins for Development

Consider installing these plugins for easier development:

- **Query Monitor**: Debugging and profiling
- **Log HTTP Requests**: Track HTTP requests
- **WordPress Importer**: Import demo content
- **WP Crontrol**: Manage scheduled tasks
- **Developer**: Theme and plugin debugging tools

## üõ†Ô∏è Maintenance

### Update WordPress Core
```bash
docker-compose exec wpcli wp core update
docker-compose exec wpcli wp core update-db
```

### Update Plugins
```bash
docker-compose exec wpcli wp plugin update --all
```

### Update Themes
```bash
docker-compose exec wpcli wp theme update --all
```

### Cleanup Unused Images
```bash
docker image prune
```

## üöÄ Production Deployment Notes

While this setup is ideal for development, for production consider:

1. Using external managed databases (AWS RDS, Google Cloud SQL, etc.)
2. Implementing a CDN for static assets
3. Adding Redis for caching
4. Implementing proper monitoring and logging
5. Setting up automated backups
6. Using production-grade SSL certificates (Let's Encrypt)

## ü§ù Contributing

Feel free to fork this repository and submit pull requests for improvements!

## üìÑ License

This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the LICENSE file for details.

## üÜò Support

If you encounter any issues or have questions:

1. Check the troubleshooting section above
2. Verify your Docker installation and versions
3. Create an issue in the repository (if applicable)

Based on the analysis of `theme.md`, `menu.md`, and the project context, here is a detailed UI/UX description for recreating the **Observatoire R√©gional de la La√Øcit√© de Bourgogne-Franche-Comt√©** website in Figma.

### 1. Design Concept & Identity
*   **Style:** Official, institutional, clean, and professional.
*   **Inspiration:** French government websites (e.g., `laicite.gouv.fr`).
*   **Vibe:** Serious, trustworthy, authoritative, yet accessible.

### 2. Color Palette
*   **Primary Brand Color (Marianne Blue):** `#000091` (Used for header, primary buttons, active states).
*   **Secondary Accent (Republican Red):** `#E1000F` (Used sparingly for urgent CTAs or highlights).
*   **Backgrounds:**
    *   **Main Page:** `#FFFFFF` (White).
    *   **Sections/Cards Alt:** `#F6F6F6` (Light Gray).
*   **Typography Colors:**
    *   **Primary Text:** `#161616` (Deep Black).
    *   **Secondary Text:** `#666666` (Dark Gray for excerpts/meta).
*   **Borders/Dividers:** `#DDDDDD` or `#E5E5E5`.

### 3. Typography
*   **Font Stack:** System fonts for optimal performance and native feel.
    *   *Figma suggestion:* Use **Inter**, **Roboto**, or **San Francisco (SF Pro)** to mimic the system font stack.
*   **Hierarchy:**
    *   **H1/Hero Titles:** Bold, large (e.g., 32px - 40px).
    *   **H2/Section Headers:** Semi-bold (e.g., 24px - 28px).
    *   **Body Text:** Regular, readable size (e.g., 16px) with generous line height (1.5).

### 4. Layout & Structure (Wireframe)

#### A. Header (Sticky or Static)
*   **Left:** Organization Logo (Observatoire R√©gional de la La√Øcit√©).
*   **Center/Right (Navigation):** Clean horizontal text links.
    *   *Items:* Actualit√©s, Tribune, Conf√©rences, Troph√©es de la la√Øcit√©, Formation.
*   **Right:** Location Filter Dropdown (Cities: Besan√ßon, Dijon, Auxerre, etc.).
*   **Style:** Minimalist with subtle bottom border.

#### B. Hero Section
*   **Background:** Full-width. Likely white or very light gray.
*   **Content:**
    *   Big, bold Title: "Observatoire r√©gional de la la√Øcit√© de Bourgogne-Franche-Comt√©".
    *   Tagline: Short mission statement.
*   **Visuals:** Professional imagery or official graphics related to secularism/government.

#### C. Quick Access Bar (Below Hero)
*   **Layout:** Horizontal row of 4 prominent cards/blocks.
*   **Content:**
    1.  Troph√©es 2025
    2.  Formations
    3.  Conf√©rences
    4.  Resources
*   **Style:** Icons + Text labels. Clear hover states.

#### D. Main Content Area (Two-Column Layout)
*   **Left Column (66% - Content):** **Article Grid**
    *   **Layout:** Responsive grid (2 columns on desktop).
    *   **Card Anatomy:**
        *   Category Tag (Small, uppercase).
        *   Headline (H3).
        *   Meta: Author & Date.
        *   Excerpt: 2-3 lines of grey text.
        *   Button: "Lire la suite ‚Üí" (Text link or outlined button).
    *   **Visual:** White cards with subtle shadow on hover.

*   **Right Column (33% - Sidebar):**
    *   **Widget 1: Call to Action:** "Troph√©es de la la√Øcit√© 2025" (Prominent box).
    *   **Widget 2: Newsletter:** Input field + "Subscribe" button.
    *   **Widget 3: Resources:** Vertical list of quick links.

#### E. Footer
*   **Top Row:** Partner Logos (carousel or grid of institutional logos).
*   **Middle Row:** Navigation Columns.
    *   **Legal:** Mentions l√©gales, Donn√©es personnelles, Accessibilit√©.
    *   **Contact:** Address, Email, Phone.
    *   **Social:** Icons for social media.
*   **Bottom:** Copyright ¬© 2025.

### 5. Navigation Menu (Full Site Map)
*   **Primary Menu:** Accueil, La√Øcit√©, L'association, Fondation, Actualit√©, Agenda, Formation, Adh√©sion, Contacts, Ressources, Partenaires.
*   **Utility/Legal:** Liens, Mentions l√©gales.

### 6. Interactive Elements
*   **Buttons:** Rectangular with slight border radius (4px). Primary blue background for main actions.
*   **Hover States:** Links change color to `#000091` or underline appears. Cards lift slightly or shadow deepens.

Yes, it will be a **separate page**.

In WordPress, you can have a custom homepage (your current one) and a separate "Posts Page" (Actualit√©s) that lists all your articles with pagination.

To make this work:
1.  **Template:** I will use `home.php`. In WordPress hierarchy, `home.php` is specifically for the "latest posts" list page, while `index.php` (or `front-page.php`) handles your landing page.
2.  **Styling:** I will ensure it looks exactly like your theme (two-column layout, institutional blue, official cards).
3.  **Pagination:** I will include the "Pr√©c√©dent / Suivant" navigation at the bottom.

I will now create the `home.php` template for you.

I've created the `home.php` file which will serve as your separate "Actualit√©s" page. 

To complete the setup, you just need to:
1.  Go to **Pages > Add New** and create a page named "Actualit√©s" (ensure the slug is `actualite`).
2.  Go to **Settings > Reading**.
3.  Set "Your homepage displays" to **A static page**.
4.  Select "Accueil" for the Homepage and **"Actualit√©s"** for the Posts page.

I will now add clean pagination styling to your `style.css` to replace the temporary inline styles.

To fix this and keep both pages working correctly, I will:
1.  **Rename your landing page design** to `front-page.php`. This tells WordPress to *always* use that design for your homepage, regardless of other settings.
2.  **Keep `home.php`** specifically for the "Actualit√©s" page.
